_exec_summary.SummaryText:
NAME CHANGE:  This facility was formerly known as "Lesaffre Yeast Corporation."  It is now known as "Red Star Yeast Co., LLC."



Executive Summary

General Accidental Release Prevention and Emergency Response

Policies

When a risk is identified, the appropriate personnel will evaluate the risk. A customized mitigation and/or response plan is then developed and implemented to respond to the particular risk or emergency situation. Furthermore, the facility is covered under the Henry County EMA Emergency Response Plan.

Red Star Yeast Co (RSYC) in Headland, AL installed an anhydrous ammonia system to bulk store anhydrous ammonia and make down dilute, 19% aqua ammonia. 



Stationary Source

Red Star Yeast Company, LLC

13211 US Highway 431 South

Headland, AL 36345



40 CFR 68 Regulated Substance(s)

1)    Aqua Ammonia

Chemical CAS# 1336-21-6

NAICS Code 311999

Threshold Quantity 20,000 lbs. 

Available Storage On-Site 130,000 lbs.

2)    Anhydrous Ammonia     

Chemical CAS# 7664-41-7

NAICS Code 311999

Threshold Quantity 10,000lbs 

Available Storage On-Site 90,000lbs 



General Accidental Release Prevention Program

Program level 2

The facility implements measures, both technological and procedural, to ensure prevention of accidental release of regulated substances. Process controls have been designed into the process to prevent and/or minimize accidental releases of regulated substances. Regular monitoring and maintenance is performed on all equipment to ensure optimum operating conditions and minimize accidents.



Five-Year Accident History



There has been no accident in the last five years at this facility.

Emergency Response Program



The facility has compiled an Emergency Response (ER) Plan, and has coordinated the

ER plan with the Henry County EMA office. In the event of an accident, the Henry

County EMA Emergency Response Plan would be activated.



Planned Changes to improve safety



Continuous Improvement is an integral part of the RMP. This includes

proactive planning and implementation of safety and process improvement ideas to further mitigate accidents at the facility. Along with the other aspects of the RMP, safety an process improvement ideas and plans will be reviewed at the regularly scheduled risk review conducted by the RMP manager and/or his designee. Each improvement will be documented in the Continuous Improvement section of the risk register with target implementation timing and responsibility. The progress of improvement idea implementation will also be reviewed during the risk review.
